summary: “They would have burned the lake if they could have,” Gendry had said, and Arya knew he was right. On the night of their escape,...
text: “They would have burned the lake if they could have,” Gendry had said, and Arya knew he was right. On the night of their escape, the flames of the burning town had shimmered so brightly on the water that it had seemed that the lake was afire.

summary: Sandor: Now if you'll excuse me, I'm just a Hound, about to stand in front of the little bird, your pretty sister, and tell...
body:
Sandor: Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m just a Hound, about to stand in front of the little bird, your pretty sister, and tell her… what the fuck am I gonna tell her?

Arya: Well, hmm, you’d better figure it out.

summary: Dark Hedges tree falls in high winds
title: Dark Hedges tree falls in high winds
excerpt: Gale force winds of up to 60 mph hit Northern Ireland overnight on Saturday.
description:
The Dark Hedges, a group of beech trees in Northern Ireland seen along a road in GoT Season 2, were first planted around 1775 – that’s even prior to American independence. But beech trees have a life expectancy of 250 years and these trees are getting close to that.

One of the trees was recently uprooted during a gale. That leaves 90 of the original 150 or so trees from the 18th century left standing.

If you wish to see these trees then it’s best not to wait too long to do so. But hopefully some farsighted people will plant new beech trees a bit further down the road so that future generations will be able to experience this phenomenon in their time.

Arya and Gendry passing through the Dark Hedges.

summary: Okay, from one honest hufflepuff to the other, just be real with me: i have to know because my gay little heart is fragile, is...
question: Okay, from one honest hufflepuff to the other, just be real with me: i have to know because my gay little heart is fragile, is there a real chance DeanArya will be a thing?
answer:
Do you mean Daenerys x Arya?? No hahahahaha I don’t think there is a chance of that happening, but I’m not sir George so that’s up to him. What I am must certain is that they will become friends and partners in changing the way the world works in ASOIAF. Both are extremely kind and caring, and they don’t care about classes and social statuses. They have a high social justice mentality and that’s extremely rare among people with “noble blood”. To be honest, they are the two tRUTHFULLY “I don’t care where you’re from” people in the series that can do a change (and Bran as well if he ever takes his place at Winterfell again) mainly Daenerys. So that’s what I’m mostly keen on what’s gonna happen. There are foreshadowing in the books, already in book 1!!, and they also have direct quote parallels which I find extremely amazing. I love them both.

Do I crackship them though? Hell yes why not they are both warrior queens, I even crackship a fucking trio ship with Jon. And the ships that are palpable: Jon and Daenerys, Arya and Jon, I love both partnerships even though I’m a Jonrya at heart.

blog.name: onefail-at-atime
blog.description: Call me Bai. Midwest. Nerd. Reader. Writer. I don't know what I'm doing. I mean really, I don't.

summary:
The Storm of Steel
Chapter One - North or South
Memories crashed through the door. Memories of riding and shooting, of tricking...
body:
The Storm of Steel

Chapter One - North or South

Memories crashed through the door. Memories of riding and shooting, of tricking siblings. Memories of comforting words and bone crushing hugs. Neither had fit in to the world they had been born in and it had made their relationship all that much stronger.

Arya wiped the food and ale from her mouth as she struggled to look for her escape. She had to go. The memories were flooding into everything and threatening to completely break through. Cersei. She was going South. Because Cersei was on her list.

But Jon.

Jon was her brother, her family. For all she knew, Jon was her only family.

She found herself outside the inn as the stable boy brought round her mare. The Southern men were already pulling their steeds towards the southern road. Arya felt her hands tighten on the reins.

North or South? Jon or Cersei? She had been so close to finding her family before. What if it was all a lie this time too?

Continued on A03

summary: ”Do you know my brothers?" she asked excitedly. "Robb and Bran are at Winterfell, and Jon's on the Wall. Jon Snow, he's in the...
body:
It’s 2019 and I’m still thinking about how Arya literally could not shut up about Jon when she found out Yoren was a black brother??? She’s all “has he made ranger yet” and doesn’t even give Yoren a chance to respond:

”Do you know my brothers?“ she asked excitedly. "Robb and Bran are at Winterfell, and Jon’s on the Wall. Jon Snow, he’s in the Night’s Watch too, you must know him, he has a direwolf, a white one with red eyes. Is Jon a ranger yet? I’m Arya Stark.” The old man in his smelly black clothes was looking at her oddly, but Arya could not seem to stop talking. “When you ride back to the Wall, would you bring Jon a letter if I wrote one?” She wished Jon were here right now. He’d believe her about the dungeons and the fat man with the forked beard and the wizard in the steel cap.

  • she doesn’t even draw breath to introduce herself until after she’s given Yoren a detailed rundown of Jon, his wolf, and his desire to be a ranger
  • so many unsent letters Arya has composed to Jon in her head. i cry a lot about the one where she found out about Wylla.
  • her certainty that Jon would believe her just underscores the fact that nobody else does – not about Illyrio and Varys plotting in the dungeon, not in general. her isolation and loneliness in KL is ghastly to behold. “Her bedchamber was the only place that Arya liked in all of King’s Landing, and the thing she liked best about it was the door.” What. On. Earth. This is Arya Underfoot, Arya “Extrovert” Stark, Arya who makes friends with everybody. She’s lonely and homesick and I just wanna give her a big hug.
  • the foolproof subject that can always get her going is JON

summary:
Arya: So Jaqen, what's the deal with your robe ?
Jaqen: What do you mean? I look humble.
Arya: No no no no no no, you look like...
body:
Arya: So Jaqen, what's the deal with your robe ?
Jaqen: What do you mean? I look humble.
Arya: No no no no no no, you look like an undercover killer TRYING to look humble.
Jaqen: I AM an undercover killer trying to look humble!

summary: Arya Stark and Aegon the Unlikely Parallels
title: Arya Stark and Aegon the Unlikely Parallels
body:
• Both are hidden royalty. Arya is a princess and Aegon was a prince.
  • Both use pseudonyms based on their real name, Arry for Arya and Egg for Aegon.
  • Both shared their traditional family looks. Arya has the Stark look and Aegon had the Targaryen look.
  • Both both have to change their hair to hide their identity. Arya has to cut her hair and Aegon has to shave it.
  • Both are mistaken for stable boys.
  • Both live for among smallfolk in their formative years.
  • Both traveled with tall, non-knights who were warriors who became members of the Kingsguard. Arya with the Hound and Aegon with Duncan the Tall.
  • Both chased smaller animals to improve their speed. Arya chased cats and Aegon chased chickens.
  • Both carry an object that connects to their true identity, Arya’s sword Needle and Aegon’s Targaryen signet ring.
  • Both are involved in an altercation with a cruel prince. Arya with Joffery on the way to King’s Landing and Aegon with his brother Aerion at Ashford.
  • Both had a brother in the Night’s Watch, Jon for Arya and Aemon for Aegon.
  • Both have interactions with the Ghost of High Heart. Arya meets her when she’s with the Brotherhood Without Banners and Jenny of Oldstones brought her court where she told Aegon and his family about the prophecy of the Prince That Was Promised.

I’m not sure if they’ll mean anything to Arya’s story in the future but I just thought they were interesting parallels.

  • Both live for among smallfolk in their formative years.
  • Both traveled with tall, non-knights who were warriors who became members of the Kingsguard. Arya with the Hound and Aegon with Duncan the Tall.
  • Both chased smaller animals to improve their speed. Arya chased cats and Aegon chased chickens.
  • Both carry an object that connects to their true identity, Arya’s sword Needle and Aegon’s Targaryen signet ring.
  • Both are involved in an altercation with a cruel prince. Arya with Joffery on the way to King’s Landing and Aegon with his brother Aerion at Ashford.
  • Both had a brother in the Night’s Watch, Jon for Arya and Aemon for Aegon.
  • Both have interactions with the Ghost of High Heart. Arya meets her when she’s with the Brotherhood Without Banners and Jenny of Oldstones brought her court where she told Aegon and his family about the prophecy of the Prince That Was Promised.

I’m not sure if they’ll mean anything to Arya’s story in the future but I just thought they were interesting parallels.

trail.content_raw:
• Both are hidden royalty. Arya is a princess and Aegon was a prince.
  • Both use pseudonyms based on their real name, Arry for Arya and Egg for Aegon.
  • Both shared their traditional family looks. Arya has the Stark look and Aegon had the Targaryen look.
  • Both both have to change their hair to hide their identity. Arya has to cut her hair and Aegon has to shave it.
  • Both are mistaken for stable boys.
  • Both live for among smallfolk in their formative years.
  • Both traveled with tall, non-knights who were warriors who became members of the Kingsguard. Arya with the Hound and Aegon with Duncan the Tall.
  • Both chased smaller animals to improve their speed. Arya chased cats and Aegon chased chickens.
  • Both carry an object that connects to their true identity, Arya’s sword Needle and Aegon’s Targaryen signet ring.
  • Both are involved in an altercation with a cruel prince. Arya with Joffery on the way to King’s Landing and Aegon with his brother Aerion at Ashford.
  • Both had a brother in the Night’s Watch, Jon for Arya and Aemon for Aegon.
  • Both have interactions with the Ghost of High Heart. Arya meets her when she’s with the Brotherhood Without Banners and Jenny of Oldstones brought her court where she told Aegon and his family about the prophecy of the Prince That Was Promised.

I’m not sure if they’ll mean anything to Arya’s story in the future but I just thought they were interesting parallels.
trail.content:
• Both are hidden royalty. Arya is a princess and Aegon was a prince.
  • Both use pseudonyms based on their real name, Arry for Arya and Egg for Aegon.
  • Both shared their traditional family looks. Arya has the Stark look and Aegon had the Targaryen look.
  • Both both have to change their hair to hide their identity. Arya has to cut her hair and Aegon has to shave it.
  • Both are mistaken for stable boys.
  • Both live for among smallfolk in their formative years.
  • Both traveled with tall, non-knights who were warriors who became members of the Kingsguard. Arya with the Hound and Aegon with Duncan the Tall.
  • Both chased smaller animals to improve their speed. Arya chased cats and Aegon chased chickens.
  • Both carry an object that connects to their true identity, Arya’s sword Needle and Aegon’s Targaryen signet ring.
  • Both are involved in an altercation with a cruel prince. Arya with Joffery on the way to King’s Landing and Aegon with his brother Aerion at Ashford.
  • Both had a brother in the Night’s Watch, Jon for Arya and Aemon for Aegon.
  • Both have interactions with the Ghost of High Heart. Arya meets her when she’s with the Brotherhood Without Banners and Jenny of Oldstones brought her court where she told Aegon and his family about the prophecy of the Prince That Was Promised.

I’m not sure if they’ll mean anything to Arya’s story in the future but I just thought they were interesting parallels.

summary:
arya stark positivity post
27/01
in a world dominated by the achievements of men, arya stark’s heroes are all women. 
she names...
body:
arya stark positivity post

27/01

in a world dominated by the achievements of men, arya stark’s heroes are all women.

she names her direwolf after the warrior queen nymeria of the rhoyne.

she credits rhaenys and visenya targaryen alongside their brother-husband for conquering the realm, where others would only mention aegon by name.

she admires brienne of tarth’s skill and expresses a desire to train with her.

arya does not care for the misogyny or the double-standards of history.

be it on the show or in the books, arya stark is a feminist.

summary: the night wolf & the white wolf | most anticipated reunion in s8 “Arya never seemed to fit, no more than he had… yet she could...
caption:
the night wolf & the white wolf | most anticipated reunion in s8

“Arya never seemed to fit, no more than he had… yet she could always make Jon smile. He would give anything to be with her now, to muss up her hair once more and watch her make a face, to hear her finish a sentence with him.”
